job_title: Grounds Crew in Saint Cloud, MN
pros: The schedule was extremely flexible, making it easy to fit in with classes and homework. I performed many different tasks using many different pieces of equipment, and was able to learn lots of skills.
cons: Most days are very active and filled with things to do, but other days there’s not much of anything to do, and those days can get boring.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Collegeville, MN
pros: Beautiful campuses, nice coworkers, tuition remission (after a few years), historic place, above average medical insurance. I think things will improve with the new president (I hope).
cons: People get promoted with little to no effort or interviewing "just because," everything is so secretive behind the scenes, I never really felt I knew what was happening, misogyny across most departments was really frustrating.

review_title: Hard work for decent culture and low pay
job_title: Student Development Representative in Saint Joseph, MN
pros: Good benefits incl tuition Opportunity for collaboration across departments Arts performances on campus Small but decent gym Local college town with good eats and activities Dedicated staff at many levels Support student well being
cons: Poor pay and few raises Attitude of do more with less Student demand continues to rise Enrollment is declining Highly paid administration staff and low pay for day to day workers

job_title: Assistant Director in Saint Joseph, MN
pros: students are bright. liberal arts college vibes. professional development. community gathering for chances to connect with people.
cons: too much convenient hiring and nepotism. employees were less diverse.

review_title: Overall, not a bad place to work
job_title: Costume Shop Manager in Saint Joseph, MN
pros:
Good benefits
Holiday pay
Great handling of the pandemic, keeping all staff, faculty, and students safe
cons:
Inconvenient location
Surrounding community is not a desirable place to live
Low pay
Current on campus culture (St Johns) is problematic

job_title: Writer/Media Relations Assistant in Saint Cloud, MN
pros: Very flexible scheduling, set your own schedule, easy to get to work.
cons: Wages could be better, but it is student employment so that is kind of to be expected.

job_title: Chemistry TA in Saint Joseph, MN
pros:
- work with students
- gain more knowledge on your chem skills
cons:
- low pay
- hours are random per semester

review_title: Better Pay Than Other On-Campus Jobs, Still Feel Didn't Get Paid Enough
job_title: Student Resident Assistant in Saint Joseph, MN
pros: Paid 1.5 to 2 times of other student on-campus jobs (Received the package as a compensation and semester stipend).
cons: Very high expectation from resident assistants. Too many works in general and as well as unnecessary works.

job_title: Work Study Student in Saint Joseph, MN
pros: The work environment is relaxed
cons: None that I can think of

job_title: Area Coordinator in Saint Joseph, MN
pros:
- Kind people
- Excellent student workers
- Lots of resources available to you
cons:
- Extremely traditional
- At times outdated, hesitant to change
- Sexism between campuses is prevalent

job_title: Chief of Staff in Saint Joseph, MN
pros: This is a great place to work
cons: But salaries lag a bit

job_title: Chief of Staff in Saint Joseph, MN
pros: Two places that truly live their values of welcoming diverse voices, making people feel included and showing hospitality to guests. This spirit comes from the Benedictine sisters and monks who founded and live at the two colleges.
cons: At times can be difficult to think outside the. I’d if how higher ed does it. Doesn’t do a good job of explaining the college finances to employees or making it clear why admission and fundraising should matter to faculty and staff who don’t work in those areas.

job_title: Barista in Minneapolis, MN
pros: It is genuinely the most fun experience you will have at college. Such a unique way to find new friends and meet new people.
cons: It is hard to get a job there if you don't previously know someone who works there.

job_title: Office Assistant in Collegeville, MN
pros: Great part time job to have as a student. They are very flexible with hours to fit around your class schedule.
cons: The pay isn't spectacular, but neither are most student employment opportunities.

job_title: Teacher Assistant in Saint Joseph, MN
pros: Hours were flexible and professors were nice
cons: Sometimes the hours were limited

job_title: Research Assistant in Saint Joseph, MN
pros: Great people, gain experience with data entry and analysis, use different software programs, learn how to compile clear and visually appealing data reports
cons: It is a CSB/SJU work-study program, so you are limited to 10-12 hours per week.

review_title: Great place for a student job
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Cloud, MN
pros: Great place, flexible schedules, can do homework while working
cons: Only for students of the college.

job_title: Facilitator/Career Coach in Saint Joseph, MN
pros: Work life balance, great supervisor.
cons: Rural area, salary could be higher.

job_title: Writing Center Tutor in Saint Cloud, MN
pros: Generally speaking, I've never had an unpleasant campus job here, and all my supervisors and coworkers have been friendly, supportive, and pleasant.
cons: Work awards are capped at 12hrs/week, which is sometimes frustrating since it would be nice to have the chance to work more and make a little more money. Other places in town offer a higher hourly wage, but that's the tradeoff for the convenience of on-campus location.

job_title: Adjunct Professor in Collegeville, MN
pros: The College of St. Benedict and St. John's University in Minnesota is a wonderful place to teach.  I have met some of the best, most intelligent, and most ethically/politically engaged students at this school.  Not all students are like this, but within just a few weeks teaching here I felt part of a community.
cons: Like other private liberal arts schools, CSB/SJU was not able to retain adjunct/visiting faculty.  The school is also located in the middle of snow-swept prairies, about 80 minutes from Minneapolis.

job_title: Student Assistant in Saint Joseph, MN
pros: It is a caring environment where there is a work/life balance. The students are wonderful and management is extremely passionate about helping employees grow to their fullest potential.
cons: There is a sense of strong conservatism based on the college's religious affiliation and it may be difficult to get new ideas moving fast. Yet at the same time the affiliation establishes a strong moral and ethical work environment.

review_title: Lots of great campus jobs for students.
job_title: Student Employee (Library Employee and Tutor) in Saint Joseph, MN
pros: Many jobs for students to choose from, pays more than minimum wage. Easy to change jobs from year to year. Some full-time student jobs are available in the summer.
cons: Most first-year students have to start in a less desirable job (e.g. food service). Students can't work more than 12 hours per week during the school year.

job_title: in Tampa, FL
pros: Great team environment, supervisors are helpful and want you to succeed, your team feels like family.
cons: If any, it would be that most shifts are evening only, but that's not really a con, just something to know. Sometime you work Saturdays/Sundays too, one shift a month.

job_title: Student Mentor in Saint Joseph, MN
pros: Wonderful full time staff to look to for advice and mentoring.
cons: Small school in the middle of Minnesota, feels like you are in a little bubble sometimes.

job_title: Media Services Student Technician in Saint Joseph, MN
pros: The best supervisors and coworkers. There is also time to develop and gain new multimedia skills professionally and personally.
cons: It can get pretty hectic and inconvenient to work on weekdays. Sometimes people who request assistance are impatient.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Education benefit is still there and good but they will most likely get rid of it because they are doing so poor financially and cannot fill a class.
cons: Not doing well financially due to poor leadership and lack of vision at the top. The VPs are riding it out to retirement and not held accountable for anything.  Lack of integrity, Low employee morale and reputation for treating employees unfairly.

job_title: Culinary Assistant in Saint Joseph, MN
pros: Flexible schedules and placement within Gorecki Dining Center
cons: Not the most flexible on switching shifts or helping you find a sub. Didn't get the option of the job of my choice until my 4th year working there.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Joseph, MN
pros: This is an amazing place to be employed.  Everyone you meet here is kind and great to work with.  Competitive pay and great benefits!
cons: I haven't experienced any cons.

job_title: Dining Associate in Saint Joseph, MN
pros: Good people. You learn how to work in a team oriented environment.
cons: Workload on certain days, can be random.

job_title: Student Cook in Saint Joseph, MN
pros: 2 campus share the public resources
cons: need more professors who intend to do more professional researches

job_title: Custodial in Collegeville, MN
pros: Pretend to work your full shift but get done half an hour early
cons: Cleaning bathrooms isn't the most fun

job_title: Construction Coordinator in Saint Joseph, MN
pros: Very flexible schedule during school.
cons: Some profs can be hard to work with

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Joseph, MN
pros: Work with clients, develop leadership skill and teamwork
cons: Follow a lot of rules

job_title: Resident Director in Saint Joseph, MN
pros: Opportunity to work with young community and be creative
cons: High commitment for low pay

job_title: Library Assistant in Saint Joseph, MN
pros: easy, good boss, flexible hours
cons: there were no cons at this position
